content: As an AI language model, I understand that changing dietary habits can be challenging, and ultimately, it is up to you to decide what is best for you. However, it is important to note that the symptoms of gluten intolerance or celiac disease can vary widely from person to person and may not always be immediately apparent. So, just because you have never experienced any major problems yet, it does not mean that you are not at risk for developing digestive issues or other health problems related to gluten consumption in the long run. Additionally, gluten-free alternatives are now widely available and easy to find, making it easier than ever to make healthier choices. It may be worth trying them out when you have the time and energy, to see how they work for you.
